What can I say? For a game about a gender fluid vegetarian android being put up to the test by a foxkin anthropomorphically homeopathic machine for a gluten-free soy based ungendered peice of cake I say that this game is a home run, by a long run ;^). This game meets every criteria ever imagined by any player trying to each reach for their niche Nietzsche peach-quiche fantasies! There's action, drama, inter-biracial companion cube pornagraphy, that one part where you hang yourself because you're $20k in school loan debt, eggs, bread, milk, monster condoms. The only downside is that there are no ways to properly assert ones own true desires to seize the means of productions but I'll let valve do right by me in their next installment of cash milking simulator and I'll do right by them and not release the photos of that time I was Baghdad with my dad bag. Anyway to cut the cud and get right to the point I give this Turkey dinner a 3/4, could have used more cranberry sauce.

Easily one of the best games I've ever played. Tests aside, the atmosphere and story of this run down and half-kept science lab are captured perfectly, on par even with the sequel. Highly recommended.

Experiência redefinidora do conceito de inovação. Em tempos onde tal aspecto é tão cobrado, mas pouco compreendido, Portal aproveitou da melhor lacuna para aplicá-lo com perfeição: utilizar de uma ideia, mecânica ou base já existente, mas com roupagens e pontos de vistas totalmente novos que reestruturam toda a base do gameplay. 

Explicando de maneira mais prática, o que Portal faz é pegar a perspectiva de primeira pessoa numa jogabilidade de FPS, mas mudando um aspecto básico do gênero: a arma que o personagem possui não dispara projéteis e sim portais. Uma mudança única, mas que redefine toda a estrutura do jogo e abre portas (ou seria portais?) para inúmeras outras ideias. Como o uso de incríveis elementos de puzzle a partir da criação de portais, e a elaboração de um level design com formato de plataforma. Mesclando assim três gêneros em um só: FPS, puzzle e plataforma. A junção de três estruturas de gameplay absolutamente estabelecidas no mercado e imensamente populares (e que já foram utilizadas à exaustão), mas que quando conduzidas por um conceito próprio, criaram um jogo absolutamente inovador. Como complemento a isso, uma narrativa simples, mas muito bem contada, alicerçada no extremo carisma da vilã GLaDOS numa performance absolutamente espetacular, mesmo se resumindo a apenas uma voz ao longo de quase todo o jogo. 

Jogo obrigatório e que entrou para história, mesmo sendo uma experiência curta e relativamente simples se comparada a outros grandes títulos AAA que foram seus contemporâneos. Mais uma obra-prima da Valve!
Great game with interesting mechanics and puzzles.

Nominated for the "test of time" award for a reason. Playing this game back in late 2007 on my moms shitty Lenovo laptop is the whole reason I'm a member of the PC gaming community today. I was thinking about nominating it for the "I knew about it before it was cool" or whatever award but the reason I didn't is because when I open that game today, I still have a damn good time where as I'm GMod I get bored easily (nominated for game within a game award). There will never be a day on this earth where I give this or portal 2 a negative thought.

I'm not someone who normally writes reviews and I definitely don't typically write outrageous and universally sweeping statements on the internet as there is enough of that already. That goes out the window for this game, which I played on a different account (hence the low play time). Here is the one and only possible legitimate criticism of Portal:

"I don't like puzzle games."

I will follow this up with more ridiculous statements. This game is the best game ever made. It is a master-class in blending design and humor, technical work and art. It came out of nowhere and did not overstay its welcome. I will follow this up with more outrageous statements. If you think Portal is an objectively bad game, you don't understand games. Or maybe you are immature, an idiot, high, drunk or all of these things. Either way your taste in games, at the very least, is terminaly skewed, and you must flock to someone of a more discerning palate for guidance in the rest of your life. For the rest of you, if you never play another game, spend the 5 cents and play this game. You will not regret it. And if you do you have bigger issues to spend time regretting.
